title: I've just done the math and realized that the ornn buffs are much better than they look.
body:
Because of the way Ornn's w functions, it didn't actually deal 25% of the targets max health when the target was full health. Because it does damage over time the damage it does is itself reduced after each instance of damage.

If we say it does damage 5 times over its duration to simplify, it used to deal 5% current health on every instance of damage. Meaning if a target has 1000 hp then it's going to deal 50 + 47.5 + 45.125 + 42.869 + 40.723 = 226.22 damage the equivalent of 22.6% max hp before resists. 

Compare that to the new max hp damage and you get 1000 \* 4% \* 5= 200, 20% max hp.

So there is still a small damage drop from full health, but once the target is below22.6% max hp this is just a massive buff as the current hp damage decreases massively but the total hp damage will not.

That small 2.6% damage nerf amounts to nothing after you realize how much more damage will be done afterwards.

So that's it. There's no real point to this post except spewin out a few numbers I thought would be interesting to calculate.
